title: Star Wars 'a childhood dream' for Benicio del Toro
text:
Star Wars 'a childhood dream' for Benicio del Toro Star Wars 'a childhood dream' for Benicio del Toro 
Press Association 2014 / / National Entertainment News Share 
Benicio del Toro has revealed how landing a role in one of the new Star Wars films is a childhood dream come true. 
The Puerto Rican actor has an as-yet-unspecified part in Star Wars: Episode VIII, where he is expected to join cast members of the seventh film, The Force Awakens, including Oscar Isaac, Daisy Ridley and John Boyega. 
He revealed he loved being able to live his dream, saying: “I was a fan, especially of the first three ones – Star Wars, The Empire Strikes Back and The Return Of The Jedi. 
“I watched them when I was a kid and I liked them. It’s kind of exciting to be part of one of those posters I had in my bedroom when I was a kid. I like R2-D2 and C-3PO and Chewbacca.” 
There had been speculation that the actor is in line to play a villain, but he remains tight-lipped over his role. Emily Blunt and Benicio del Toro (Ian West/PA) 
Meanwhile, Benicio has reunited with Emily Blunt for crime thriller Sicario. The pair previously worked together on The Wolfman in 2010. 
“I think Emily and I work in a very similar way. She’s not afraid to stop you if she doesn’t understand what’s going on and ask questions, and look for that truth… so it’s nice to work with someone that kind of goes about the same way as you do. That way you don’t feel alone,” he said. 
“We’ve known each other now for some time so there’s an element of trust that makes it easy to be silly and make a fool of yourself.” 
Benicio plays CIA agent Alejandro Gillick, who makes some questionable choices, in Denis Villeneuve’s movie. 
“The characters are compelling because as I read it, I understood what motivated him, and why he was doing what he was doing, but then I was repulsed by some of the actions,” the actor explained. 
“I feel I’ve never really played that type of character driven by revenge so the script, the character, made me get excited.” Share article 
Sicario is in cinemas now. Promoted Stories
